decks.notes: The main concept of this Golgari Aggro deck is to quickly establish a board presence with efficient creatures like Walking Ballista, Verdurous Gearhulk, and Ravenous Chupacabra, while utilizing cards like Winding Constrictor and Rishkar, Peema Renegade to maximize the value of +1/+1 counters. The deck also includes cards like Glint-Sleeve Siphoner and Aethersphere Harvester to generate card advantage and maintain tempo. Additionally, the deck includes mana ramp in the form of Llanowar Elves and Adventurous Impulse to ensure a smooth curve and consistent pressure on the opponent.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on building a strong board presence with powerful creatures like Lyra Dawnbringer and Shalai, Voice of Plenty, supported by mana accelerants like Llanowar Elves and Servant of the Conduit. The deck also includes removal options like Cast Out and Angel of Sanctions, as well as buff spells like Blossoming Defense to protect key creatures. With a mix of aggressive creatures and versatile spells, this deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents and secure victory through combat damage.

This Mono Black Control deck focuses on disruption and removal to control the opponent's board while building card advantage and finding ways to win the game. Utilizing cards like Vraska's Contempt, Fatal Push, and Duress to disrupt the opponent, while The Eldest Reborn and Gonti, Lord of Luxury provide additional value and card advantage. The deck also includes utility lands like Field of Ruin and Scavenger Grounds to deal with problematic permanents, and a combination of efficient threats like Gifted Aetherborn and Walking Ballista to close out the game.

This Dimir Aggro deck focuses on early aggression and card advantage, using efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Cast Down to control the board. Glint-Sleeve Siphoner and Champion of Wits provide card draw and card selection while applying pressure. The deck also has strong finishers in The Scarab God and Torrential Gearhulk, allowing for a late-game advantage. Field of Ruin and Doomfall provide additional disruption, ensuring the deck can handle a variety of threats and strategies. With a mix of control and aggression, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with consistent pressure and disruption.

The main idea behind this deck is to quickly flood the board with aggressive creatures that can deal damage to the opponent consistently. By utilizing cards like Goblin Chainwhirler, Earthshaker Khenra, and Ahn-Crop Crasher, the aim is to establish early dominance and maintain pressure on the opponent. With a focus on burn spells like Shock, Lightning Strike, and Abrade, as well as the prowess of cards like Soul-Scar Mage and Hazoret the Fervent, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory through efficient and relentless aggression.

The focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells, keeping the pressure on and not allowing the opponent to stabilize. By consistently applying pressure with hasty creatures like Earthshaker Khenra and Ahn-Crop Crasher, while also utilizing powerful cards like Hazoret the Fervent and Rekindling Phoenix, this deck aims to quickly close out the game before the opponent has a chance to mount a defense. With a low land count and a high density of threats, this deck aims to win as quickly as possible.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using a combination of powerful creatures and removal spells. The deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent early in the game with creatures like Scrapheap Scrounger, Goblin Chainwhirler, and Walking Ballista, while also using efficient removal spells like Unlicensed Disintegration and Abrade to control the board. Additionally, cards like Heart of Kiran and Karn, Scion of Urza provide additional value and card advantage to help maintain momentum and overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent through countering their spells, removing their threats, and card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and control the board until it can establish a dominant position with powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. The deck also uses cards like Settle the Wreckage and Fumigate to wipe the board if necessary. The goal is to outvalue the opponent by generating card advantage and outlasting them in a war of attrition, ultimately winning the game through superior control and card advantage.

The main idea of the deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, removing their threats, and using Teferi, Hero of Dominaria to generate card advantage. The deck aims to prolong the game until it can win with Approach of the Second Sun. It uses cards like Syncopate, Disallow, and Settle the Wreckage to control the board, while also having cards like Fumigate and Cast Out for removal. Search for Azcanta helps dig through the deck for key cards, while Seal Away and Blink of an Eye provide additional tempo control.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage provided by Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Search for Azcanta. It aims to stall the opponent's threats with cards like Seal Away and Settle the Wreckage, while disrupting their plans with Disallow and Negate. The win condition is to cast Approach of the Second Sun twice, using cards like Glimmer of Genius to dig for it and control the board until it can be safely cast. The deck also includes board wipes like Fumigate and removal spells like Cast Out to deal with threats.

The main concept of this Golgari Aggro deck is to quickly build a board presence with efficient creatures like Walking Ballista, Verdurous Gearhulk, and Winding Constrictor, while utilizing cards like Glint-Sleeve Siphoner and Jadelight Ranger for card advantage and mana ramp. The deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent early in the game and maintain that pressure throughout, with cards like Rishkar, Peema Renegade and Ravenous Chupacabra providing additional utility and removal options. The deck also includes a small amount of removal and protection spells to deal with opposing threats and ensure the deck's aggression goes uncontested.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast-paced aggressive strategy, utilizing powerful red creatures like Rekindling Phoenix, Hazoret the Fervent, and Goblin Chainwhirler. The deck aims to quickly establish board control and apply constant pressure to the opponent, using efficient burn spells like Magma Spray and Lightning Strike to clear the way for attacks. With a strong curve and versatile removal options, the deck seeks to deal damage quickly and efficiently to secure victory before the opponent can stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using various artifacts and cards that allow for improvisation and adaptation to different situations. This is achieved through cards like Herald of Anguish, Metallic Rebuke, and Karn, Scion of Urza. The deck also utilizes cards like Prophetic Prism and Renegade Map to ensure smooth mana curve and card draw. Additionally, The Antiquities War and Treasure Map provide win conditions by turning artifacts into powerful threats. Overall, the deck is built to outvalue opponents with its versatile and strategic playstyle.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures and artifacts to quickly overwhelm opponents. It combines creatures like Scrapheap Scrounger, Knight of Malice, and Toolcraft Exemplar with powerful artifacts such as Walking Ballista and Heart of Kiran. Removal spells like Fatal Push and Cast Out help control the board, while planeswalkers like Gideon of the Trials and Karn, Scion of Urza provide additional threats and card advantage. The mana base is designed to support the Orzhov color combination, with a mix of Plains, Swamps, and dual lands like Concealed Courtyard and Isolated Chapel.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence with efficient, high-power creatures like Steel Leaf Champion and Ghalta, Primal Hunger, supported by mana ramp from cards like Llanowar Elves and Servant of the Conduit. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and utilize powerful green spells like Blossoming Defense to protect its threats. The inclusion of Heart of Kiran and Skysovereign, Consul Flagship provides additional reach and removal options. Overall, the strategy revolves around deploying strong creatures early and maintaining pressure throughout the game.

The main concept of this deck is to maintain a fast and aggressive playstyle with a focus on utilizing efficient creatures and removal spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By combining powerful threats like Glorybringer and Bristling Hydra with mana acceleration from Llanowar Elves and Servant of the Conduit, the deck aims to establish an early board presence and maintain pressure throughout the game. Additionally, cards like Chandra, Torch of Defiance provide additional versatility and reach, while removal spells like Abrade and Harnessed Lightning help control the opponent's creatures and clear the way for attacks.
